channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: A Perl Equation that just Makes Sense
item.description: This well-known company builds the that software hosting companies use to allow customers to build websites. The software you create will be deployed on thousands of servers all over the internet, and used by hundreds of thousands of people! Best of all, the client has a killer relocation program, so if you land this one, it???s Houston, here you come.

item.title: Seeking Abominable Snowman (or Snowwoman) for Junior Perl Developer Role!
item.description: What would you say if I told you there was a ski-in/ski-out job waiting for you in Switzerland? Okay, so the ski-in/ski-out part might be as difficult to find as a yeti in a blizzard, but if you???re a junior developer who is a fan of the great outdoors and you???ve got excellent English skills, then we have the role for you!

item.title: You + This Job = Love?
item.description: A company for the modern age, this is a family business that has grown by leaps and bounds. 100% owned by the founders and directors, they???re in love with what they do, and they want to find others who adore developing new features and fixing bugs in a secure, well-tested, and performant way.

item.title: Bored of jobs that don't matter? Be a Perl developer and save lives
item.description: This web-app saves lives, and literally pushes forward medical science. Your work will be used by the NHS, research labs, and healthcare providers worldwide to diagnose patients, organize research, and make the world a better place.

item.title: A New Way to Work. Perl Job in London
item.description: Our client is looking for a senior-level Perl programmer who believes in innovation. They are one of the UK???s leading estate agencies with over 60 branches and a spectacular web presence that puts others to shame. Leave behind the offices of old and get ready for a tiered lake, decked boardwalk, pathways, events space, and an on-site Virgin Active gym.

item.description: June 23-27 2020 Houston, TX

item.description: Another magical Raku work shared by Luca. Highly Recommended.

item.description: For the first time, Laurent only managed to do 3 Sum task in Raku.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 51
item.description: Jaldhar showing you don't need to write long code in Raku. Less is enough.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 051: 3 Sum and Colourful Numbers
item.description: Choroba as always came up with unique solution to the Colorful number task. Highly Recommended.

item.description: Arne shared the power of Junction operator of Raku and many more.

item.title: More Perl & Prolog
item.description: Adam used Prolog once again to solve the weekly challenge.

item.description: Recap of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.

item.description: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.

item.title: February report of the Perl 6 Development Grant of Jonathan Worthington
Extracting coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 spike protein sequences with BioPerl

item.description: That's a very strange title to a very strange post about changint time. I mean the 'time' function of Perl.

item.title: KBOS methods
item.description: Let's talk about the syntax and semantics of KBOS methods. The Kephra Base Object System (KBOS - read: ok boss)

item.title: Who makes it into @INC first?
item.description: To quote brian: 'Perl finds modules by looking through the list of directories in @INC. There are many ways to add paths to that array, and although Iâ€™ve used all of them at some point, Iâ€™ve never quite thought about what happens when I use all of them together.'

item.title: No Paws in this post (well maybe a litte)
#451 - Farewell DrForr
item.description:
Hi there

I've just read the sad news that Jeff Goff (aka DrForr) died. RIP DrForr

I wish we'll have a better week!
